title: Heronian triangle
summary: In geometry, a Heronian triangle (or Heron triangle) is a triangle whose side lengths a, b, and c and area A are all integers.[1][2] Heronian triangles are named after Heron of Alexandria, based on their relation to Heron's formula which Heron demonstrated with the example triangle of sides 13, 14, 15 and area 84.[3]
